state_machine.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 # !/usr/local/bin/python
2 import rospy
3 
4 class StateMachine:
5  """StateMachine
6  This module is a template for state machine
7  It can add, states and handles the running
8  """
9 
10  def __init__(self):
11  self.handlers = {}
12  self.startState = None
13  self.endStates = []
14 
15  def add_state(self, name, handler, end_state=0):
16  """
17  Add a state to the state machine
18  @param name string
19  @handler function
20  """
21  name = name.upper()
22  self.handlers[name] = handler
23  if end_state:
24  self.endStates.append(name)
25 
26  def set_start(self, name):
27  """
28  set the start state of the state machine
29  @param name string
30  """
31  self.startState = name.upper()
32 
33  def run(self, ):
34  """
35  Run the state machine
36  """
37  try:
38  handler = self.handlers[self.startState]
39  except:
40  rospy.logwarn("must call .set_start() before .run()")
41  if not self.endStates:
42  rospy.logwarn("at least one state must be an end_state")
43 
44  old_state = ""
45  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
46  try:
47  (newState) = handler()
48  if(newState != old_state):
49  rospy.loginfo(newState)
50  old_state = newState
51  if newState.upper() in self.endStates:
52  rospy.loginfo("reached ", newState)
53  break
54  else:
55  handler = self.handlers[newState.upper()]
56  except KeyboardInterrupt:
57  break
